text: you've probably made your share of grain
salads before but have you ever tried a
quinoa salad quinoa is very high protein
and it's really tasty
especially in this salad where I've
mixed it with soft roasted carrots and
crunchy fried leeks and you can serve it
either as a side dish or a main course
quinoa is really easy to cook you can
cook it just like pasta you just bring a
big pot of salted water to a boil add
your quinoa and you'll end up with a big
bowl like this by the way if you see red
quinoa which looks like this go ahead
and substitute it either one will work
in this recipe although it might take a
little longer to cook one of the things
that makes this quinoa so delicious is
that I put crunchy fried leeks all over
the top and to make the leeks is really
easy you want to add just enough oil to
cover the leeks take them out as they
Brown as the leeks come out of the
skillet you just want to salt them as
you go to make sure that they're well
seasoned and then you can add the next
batch so this is a lot of carrots but
this recipe makes a lot of salad which
is good all you want to do is add enough
oil to coat them and then a good pinch
of salt pepper just give it a stir make
sure just to spread them out on the
baking sheet so there's some room in
between them because otherwise they will
steam instead of getting nice and brown
and what you want is nice and brown I
know I'm just gonna roast them until
they're golden see these trim hold up a
lot these look good so while the carrots
are cooling I'm just gonna make a quick
little dressing and I'm gonna make it
with pomegranate molasses which is one
of my favorite things and it's not that
hard to find these days big supermarkets
have it or you can order it online and
it has this amazing sweet tartness and
also a nice thick texture which is great
adds texture to the dressing just have a
little lemon juice here and this is the
pomegranate molasses salt you always
want to add the salt before you add the
oil because it dissolves better you know
a whisk
not powder ground of molasses is just so
good I know I'm just gonna mix
everything together but I'm gonna do it
in stages first thing yeah the carrot to
the quinoa just gonna add some of the
dressing I'm gonna whisk it before I add
it that way it's well mixed this is a
kind of recipe where you must taste as
you go because quinoa can often take a
lot more salt than you think and then
now I'm just gonna dress my arugula
whisk this up before you add it and then
add it a little at a time because you
don't know that you're gonna use all of
it and then your hands are your best
salad toss there's clean hands in place
yeah you see this is well coated I'm not
gonna use the rest of my dressing this
is plenty you want to do all of this as
close to serving time as possible and
then now I'm just gonna plate it and
bring it right up greens go on the
bottom quinoa goes on top and your fried
leeks go right on top and now I'm just
gonna finish this
just a little pomegranate molasses this
stuff is powerful so just a couple of
drops and that is that and now I invite
every single person I know to come over
any quinoa salad with me because this
recipe makes a mountain of quinoa salad
Oh
